example.english: The book has 500 pages.
example.spanish: El libro tiene 500 páginas.

example.english: Click here to go back to previous page.
example.spanish: Haz clic aquí para volver a la página anterior.

example.english: Class is canceled due to the snow.
example.spanish: La clase está cancelada debido a la nieve.

example.english: How can I get rid of this snow on the screen?
example.spanish: ¿Cómo puedo quitar esta nieve de la pantalla?

example.english: I don't know what to do about my back pain.
example.spanish: No sé qué hacer con mi dolor de espalda.

example.english: I have a pain in my thumb because I jammed it in the door.
example.spanish: Me duele el pulgar porque lo machuqué en la puerta.

example.english: Penelope loves to wear thick socks.
example.spanish: A Penélope le encanta llevar calcetines gordos.

example.english: I need to buy some dress socks before my interview.
example.spanish: Necesito comprar una medias de vestir antes de mi entrevista.

example.english: The printer needs more paper.
example.spanish: La impresora necesita más papel.

example.english: There was an interesting article in the sports section of the paper.
example.spanish: Había un artículo interesante en la sección de deportes del periódico.

example.english: Soldiers quartered in trenches during the war.
example.spanish: Los soldados vivían en trincheras durante la guerra.

example.english: During the war, women raised money to buy supplies for the soldiers.
example.spanish: Durante la guerra, las mujeres recaudaban dinero para comprar provisiones a los militares.

example.english: It's a lovely day for us to go to the park.
example.spanish: Es un lindo día para irnos al parque.

example.english: You can't park a motorcycle in that space.
example.spanish: No puedes estacionar una moto en ese espacio.

example.english: Las flamencas bailaban al son de las palmas y la guitarra.
example.spanish: The flamenco dancers moved to the sound of clapping and guitar.

example.english: Todos mis amigos cubanos saben bailar el son.
example.spanish: All my Cuban friends know how to dance son.

example.english: I'm going to have a party for my 30th birthday.
example.spanish: Voy a celebrar los 30 con una fiesta.

example.english: There's a party in the main square to celebrate the New Year.
example.spanish: Hay pachanga en el Zócalo para celebrar el Año Nuevo.

example.english: Captain, the enemy spacecraft is moving at the speed of sound!
example.spanish: Capitán, ¡el aeronave enemigo se desplaza a la velocidad del sonido!

example.english: What's that sound?
example.spanish: ¿Qué es ese sonido?

example.english: That belongs in the past. It's time to move on.
example.spanish: Eso pertenece al pasado. Es hora de seguir adelante.

example.english: The country is finding it difficult to break free from its past.
example.spanish: Al país le está resultando difícil liberarse de su historia.

example.english: I love to watch how the robins play in the puddles in spring.
example.spanish: Me encanta ver cómo los petirrojos juegan en los charcos en la primavera.

example.english: They walked down to the spring to take a dip.
example.spanish: Fueron caminando hasta el manantial para echarse un chapuzón.

example.english: I hate him because he's not a good person.
example.spanish: Lo odio porque es una mala persona.

example.english: You need to conjugate this verb in the first person.
example.spanish: Tienes que conjugar este verbo en primera persona.

example.english: At night we had a clear view of the stars.
example.spanish: Por la noche veíamos las estrellas con toda claridad.

example.english: The Sun is the king star.
example.spanish: El Sol es el astro rey.

example.english: A picture is worth a thousand words.
example.spanish: Una imagen vale más que mil palabras.

example.english: I took a lot of pictures of my friends at the party.
example.spanish: Le saqué muchas fotos a mis amigas en la fiesta.

example.english: The breakup put her in a terrible state of depression.
example.spanish: La ruptura la puso en un estado terrible de depresión.

example.english: The current state of the government is favorable.
example.spanish: El estado actual del gobierno es favorable.

example.english: Teddy Roosevelt was the 26th president of the United States of America.
example.spanish: Teddy Roosevelt fue el vigésimo sexto presidente de los Estados Unidos de América.

example.english: The president of the company has the final say about the budget assigned to every department.
example.spanish: El presidente de la empresa tiene la última palabra sobre el presupuesto asignado a cada departamento.

example.english: We went to the store to buy some towels.
example.spanish: Fuimos a la tienda a comprar unas toallas.

example.english: The store was closed, so we went to the supermarket instead.
example.spanish: El almacén estaba cerrado, por lo que fuimos al supermercado.

example.english: What's the problem?
example.spanish: ¿Cuál es el problema?

example.english: Can you pick up the kids from school today? - No problem!
example.spanish: ¿Puedes recoger a los niños hoy de la escuela? - ¡No hay problema!

example.english: He's lived on the same street his entire life.
example.spanish: Ha vivido en la misma calle su vida entera.

example.english: As a writer, he's not in the same street as his father.
example.spanish: Como escritor, no está a la altura de su padre.

example.english: We supervise the manufacturing of all our products in-house.
example.spanish: Supervisamos la fabricación de todos nuestros productos internamente.

example.english: The festival's success was the product of the committee members' joint efforts.
example.spanish: El éxito del festival fue el fruto de los esfuerzos conjuntos de los miembros del comité.

example.english: He is a medical student at the University of Puerto Rico.
example.spanish: Es estudiante de medicina en la Universidad de Puerto Rico.

example.english: The brightest students don't always get the best grades.
example.spanish: Los alumnos más brillantes no siempre reciben las mejores notas.

example.english: Hey, don't touch the car. It's not your property.
example.spanish: Oye, no toques el coche. No es de tu propiedad.

example.english: Who owns the property next door?
example.spanish: ¿Quién es el dueño de la propiedad de al lado?

example.english: I rarely add sugar to my coffee.
example.spanish: Rara vez agrego azúcar al café.

example.english: Where is the sugar that I bought?
example.spanish: ¿Dónde está la azúcar que compré?

example.english: Do you have any questions about the procedure?
example.spanish: ¿Tiene alguna pregunta sobre el procedimiento?

example.english: There were ten questions on the exam.
example.spanish: Había diez preguntas en el examen.

example.english: I feel good when the sun is shining.
example.spanish: Me siento bien cuando brilla el sol.

example.english: It is advisable to use sunscreen when you sun yourself.
example.spanish: Es aconsejable utilizar protector solar cuando tomas el sol.

example.english: Miguel won the race.
example.spanish: Miguel ganó la carrera.

example.english: We're all members of the human race regardless of color or creed.
example.spanish: Todos somos miembros de la raza humana sea el que sea el color o credo.

example.english: They want to buy a table and six chairs for the dining room.
example.spanish: Quieren comprar una mesa y seis sillas para el comedor.

example.english: The waiter took the order from our table.
example.spanish: El camarero tomó nota de nuestra mesa.

example.english: Prende el radio que quiero escuchar mi emisora favorita.
example.spanish: Turn on the radio, I want to listen to my favorite station.

example.english: Utiliza el radio del círculo para encontrar su circunferencia.
example.spanish: Use the radius of the circle to find its circumference.

example.english: She is on the telephone right now. Would you like to leave a message?
example.spanish: En este momento está hablando por teléfono. ¿Quieres dejar un mensaje?

example.english: They sell vintage telephones.
example.spanish: Venden teléfonos antiguos.

example.english: If it keeps raining, we can't go to the park.
example.spanish: Si sigue lloviendo, no podemos ir al parque.

example.english: Sam took the umbrella because it's raining.
example.spanish: Sam se llevó el paraguas porque está lloviendo.

example.english: I think we should donate these things to charity.
example.spanish: Creo que debemos donar estas cosas a caridad.

example.english: What is that thing for?
example.spanish: ¿Para qué sirve ese chisme?

example.english: I'm sure she's married because she has a ring on her finger.
example.spanish: Estoy seguro de que está casada porque lleva un anillo en el dedo.

example.english: A diamond ring costs a lot of money.
example.spanish: Una sortija de diamantes cuesta mucho dinero.

example.english: The machine he built allows him to travel through time.
example.spanish: La máquina que construyó le permite viajar en el tiempo.

example.english: Do you remember what time it was exactly?
example.spanish: ¿Recuerdas qué hora era exactamente?

example.english: The river overflowed its banks due to the rain.
example.spanish: El río se desbordó a causa de la lluvia.

example.english: a river of blood
example.spanish: un río de sangre

example.english: These tomatoes look delicious.
example.spanish: Estos tomates se ven deliciosos.

example.english: I'll put some tomato in the salad.
example.spanish: Le pondré jitomate a la ensalada.

example.english: The road to Avonlea is beautiful in the spring.
example.spanish: La carretera a Avonlea está preciosa en primavera.

example.english: The children’s school is down this road on the left.
example.spanish: La escuela de los niños está por esta calle a mano izquierda.

example.english: My town doesn't have a shopping mall or a movie theater.
example.spanish: Mi pueblo no tiene un centro comercial ni un cine.

example.english: If you go into town, would you drop this off at the post office?
example.spanish: Si vas a la ciudad, ¿me llevarías esto a la oficina de correos?

example.english: The beach was full of rocks.
example.spanish: La playa estaba llena de rocas.

example.english: There's a rock in my shoe.
example.spanish: Tengo una piedra en el zapato.

example.english: You’ll need an umbrella in London.
example.spanish: Necesitarás un paraguas en Londres.

example.english: We sat under an umbrella on the beach.
example.spanish: Nos sentamos debajo de una sombrilla en la playa.

example.english: You must follow the rules of the game.
example.spanish: Tienes que seguir las reglas del juego.

example.english: You should study the traffic rules before you take the driver's test.
example.spanish: Debes estudiar las normas de circulación antes de tomar la prueba de conducir.

example.english: The village of Quepos lies in the hills of Costa Rica's pacific coast.
example.spanish: El pueblo de Quepos está ubicado en los cerros de la costa pacífica de Costa Rica.

example.english: The village where I grew up has only 500 residents.
example.spanish: La aldea donde me crié tiene solo 500 residentes.

example.english: The sand on the beach was hot.
example.spanish: La arena de la playa estaba caliente.

example.english: I hired a professional to sand the floors of my house.
example.spanish: Contraté a un profesional para que puliera el suelo de mi casa.

example.english: The war has cost thousands of soldiers and civilians their lives.
example.spanish: La guerra ha costado las vidas de miles de soldados y civiles.

example.english: The two countries have warred over this land for centuries.
example.spanish: Los dos países han combatido por esta tierra durante siglos.

example.english: Their children go to the same school on the bus.
example.spanish: Sus hijos van a la misma escuela en el autobús.

example.english: We have to go back to school at the end of August.
example.spanish: Tenemos que regresar al colegio a finales de agosto.

example.english: What is the quickest way to the airport?
example.spanish: ¿Cuál es el camino más rápido al aeropuerto?

example.english: You still have a long way to get to the hotel.
example.spanish: Todavía te queda mucha distancia por recorrer hasta el hotel.

example.english: The sea covers more than 70% of the Earth's surface.
example.spanish: El mar cubre más del 70% de la superficie de la Tierra.

example.english: These sailors loved the sea more than anything.
example.spanish: Estos marineros amaban la mar más que cualquier otra cosa.

example.english: How's the weather in New York?
example.spanish: ¿Cómo está el clima en Nueva York?

example.english: This region is famous for its awful weather.
example.spanish: Esta región es famosa por su clima horroroso.

example.english: Please take a seat.
example.spanish: Por favor, tome asiento.

example.english: There are no seats left in first class.
example.spanish: No hay asientos libres en primera clase.

example.english: I put on some weight last Christmas.
example.spanish: Subí un poco de peso las pasadas Navidades.

example.english: He goes to the gym to lift weights three times a week.
example.spanish: Él va al gimnasio a levantar pesas tres veces a la semana.

example.english: This car goes from 0 to 60 miles per hour in three seconds.
example.spanish: Este carro acelera de 0 a 60 millas por hora en tres segundos.

example.english: Come here right this second!
example.spanish: ¡Ven aquí este instante!

example.english: His wife is a pediatrician.
example.spanish: Su esposa es pediatra.

example.english: I married my wife four years ago.
example.spanish: Me casé con mi mujer hace cuatro años.

example.english: A sentence must have a verb.
example.spanish: Una oración debe llevar un verbo.

example.english: The teacher asked Eric to read the sentence on the board.
example.spanish: La profesora le pidió a Eric que leyera la frase en el pizarrón.

example.english: We should wind all of these cables so that they're easier to store.
example.spanish: Deberíamos enrollar todos estos cables para que sean más fáciles de guardar.

example.english: The workout winded him to the point that he could barely stand.
example.spanish: El ejercicio lo dejó sin resuello hasta que apenas podía pararse.

example.english: The ship leaves at 6 am loaded with cargo.
example.spanish: El barco zarpa a las 6 am repleto de carga.

example.english: Many merchant ships were sunk during the war.
example.spanish: Muchos buques mercantes fueron hundidos durante la guerra.

example.english: This classroom has big windows.
example.spanish: Este aula tiene ventanas grandes.

example.english: Can you roll down your window? It's too hot!
example.spanish: ¿Puedes bajar tu ventanilla? ¡Hace mucho calor!

example.english: She went to the mall to buy a new pair of shoes.
example.spanish: Ella fue al centro comercial para comprar un nuevo par de zapatos.

example.english: We need to replace the horse's shoes before the next race.
example.spanish: Necesitamos reemplazar las herraduras del caballo antes de la próxima carrera.

example.english: Winter is my least favorite season of the year.
example.spanish: El invierno es mi estación menos favorita del año.

example.english: We've had some terrible winter weather lately.
example.spanish: Últimamente hemos tenido un tiempo invernal terrible.

example.english: Which side of the bed do you prefer to sleep on?
example.spanish: ¿Qué lado de la cama prefieres para dormir?

example.english: She always doodles on the side of her notebook paper.
example.spanish: Ella siempre garabatea en los márgenes del folio de su cuaderno.

example.english: Women should have the same rights as men.
example.spanish: Las mujeres deberían tener los mismos derechos que los hombres.

example.english: Boss, there's a woman at recepction that wants to talk to you.
example.spanish: Jefe, hay una señora en recepción que quiere hablar con usted.

example.english: He put up a "No Parking" sign in his yard.
example.spanish: Puso un letrero que decía "Prohibido estacionarse" en su jardín.

example.english: Didn't you see the sign? U-turns aren't allowed.
example.spanish: ¿No viste la señal? No se permiten vueltas en U.

example.english: We have to write a 500-word essay for class.
example.spanish: Tenemos que escribir un ensayo de 500 palabras para la clase.

example.english: I give you my word that this will not happen again.
example.spanish: Te doy mi palabra de que esto no volverá a pasar.

example.english: What size is your car?
example.spanish: ¿De qué tamaño es su coche?

example.english: What size dress do you want?
example.spanish: ¿De qué talla quieres el vestido?

example.english: There are more than seven billion people in the world.
example.spanish: Hay más de siete mil millones de personas en el mundo.

example.english: After graduation, she plans on entering the business world.
example.spanish: Después de graduación, ella planea entrar en el mundo de los negocios.

example.english: Protect your skin from the sun.
example.spanish: Protege tu piel del sol.

example.english: You need to use a thick moisturizer for your dry skin.
example.spanish: Necesitas usar un hidratante espeso para tu cutis seco.

example.english: I am ten years old and my brother is five.
example.spanish: Tengo diez años y mi hermano tiene cinco.

example.english: This year I'm going to Costa Rica on vacation.
example.spanish: Este año me voy de vacaciones a Costa Rica.

example.english: The sky is overcast.
example.spanish: El cielo está nublado.

example.english: She was about to take the set but mishit the ball and skied it.
example.spanish: Estaba a punto de ganar el set pero golpeó mal la pelota y la lanzó hacia lo alto.

example.english: ¿Qué quieren hacer esta tarde? - Queremos ir al zoo, mamá, a ver a los monos.
example.spanish: What do you want to do this afternoon? - We want to go to the zoo, Mom, to see the monkeys.
